title: Scott Disick called Kim Kardashian asking for advise about Kourtney and Sofia
text:
Sofia admits that Scott acts differently with her and Kourtney (Picture: E!)

Scott Disick has finally admitted that he felt uncomfortable during his recent trip to Finland with his current girlfriend Sofia Richie and ex-wife Kourtney Kardashian – and he’s sought out the advice of Kim.

Insert three’s a crowd joke here.

In the most recent episode of Keeping Up With The Kardashians, Scott and Kourtney decided to take their children to the cold country for the holidays, and Sofia was, of course invited.

However all is not well in paradise, and he admitted to feeling pressured to please both women.

He said: ‘The past few months, we’ve been on a few trips where it’s been Kourtney, Sofia and the kids, and it’s been great.

Scott continued: ‘But Sofia mentioned to me that she felt left out. And I don’t want to overstep anyone’s boundaries and make anyone feel left out’.

Kim was the voice of reason (Picture: Reuters)

‘Traveling with a family like this is a unique situation that not everybody does,’ he went on to explain.

‘I definitely think this trip, out of the other trips we’ve been on, has a little bit more pressure. The truth of the matter is…there are camera crews everywhere and tons of people walking around who Kourtney and I have known for over 10 years, but Sofia’s never really done anything like this. So it’s hard. I don’t want her to feel out of place and she’s not as comfortable as I am. So I’m just trying to be conscious of everybody’s feelings’.

Riddled with worry, Scott ended up calling his ex-sister-in-law for advice.

‘It’s kind of weird,’ he told Kim Kardashian. ‘I’m trying pay attention to everyone without neglecting anyone.

‘Sofia mentioned to me that I’m acting a little different around Kourtney. It’s tough. Sometimes, Kourtney and I have so much history and have known each other for so long.

‘I’ve been trying to be mindful and not make Sofia uncomfortable, just because Kourt and I have known each other our whole lives.

‘It puts so much stress on me and turns into me not being happy. I’m not even fun to be around for anybody. I think this trip, out of the other trips we’ve been on, has been a little more pressure because there are camera crews everywhere’.

The pair patched things up (Picture: Keeping Up With The Kardashians)

To her credit, Kim sided with Sofia and encouraged her former brother-in-law to take her feelings in consideration – and reassure her that their relationship is important to him.

Advertisement

‘She seems like she’s pretty cool with everything,’ Kim told Scott during a phone call.

‘So if she’s speaking up about something that bothers her, you kind of have to pay attention and Kourtney, like, completely has to understand that’.

Scott went on to confront Kourtney, telling her that all he wants is for both women to be comfortable. ‘I want you to be comfortable, I want Sofia to be comfortable’.

‘She’s [Sofia] always like…you guys have your way…and it’s hard. She feels like she doesn’t fit in sometimes. I haven’t really had a second by myself to have a conversation and make her feel comfortable. She’s never been in this life that we’ve had for ten years. It’s a lot. I’m trying to juggle it, and being on camera is a lot for her’.

Kourtney’s response was understanding, and she told him: ‘I think you put so much pressure on this to make it perfect,’ she told him, referring to their joint holidays. ‘I don’t even mind if you guys go off and do your own thing,’ she told him. ‘I just feel like…you’re in it, then let’s enjoy what’s happening and make the most of it. If we’re all going to do something, then let’s be in the moment and have fun’.

Advertisement

Following the conversation, Scott took Sofia away to have some time to themselves, and admitted that travelling together with his children, their mother, and his girlfriend was ‘one of the best things’ in his life.
